Book-themed escape room: Create an immersive escape room experience where participants have to solve clues and puzzles related to books. The room could be designed to resemble a library, with bookshelves, a desk, and a cozy reading nook. The puzzles could involve decoding messages in the margins of books, solving riddles related to literary characters, or uncovering hidden secrets in the pages of a mysterious book.

Book-inspired cooking class: Host a cooking class where participants can learn to make dishes inspired by their favorite books. The class could start with a brief presentation on the culinary traditions of different cultures and time periods, followed by a hands-on cooking session where participants can make dishes such as a Victorian-era tea party, a medieval feast, or a modern-day gourmet meal inspired by a favorite novel.

Book-themed scavenger hunt: Organize a scavenger hunt where participants have to find and collect items related to books. The hunt could take place in a library, a bookstore, or even in the great outdoors. The clues could be hidden in plain sight, requiring participants to use their knowledge of literature and history to solve the puzzles.

Book-inspired art exhibit: Curate an art exhibit featuring works of art inspired by books. The exhibit could include paintings, sculptures, installations, or any other form of art that interprets and celebrates the power of literature. The exhibit could be held in a gallery or museum, or even in an unconventional space such as an old bookstore or a library.

Book-themed video game: Develop a video game that allows players to explore the world of literature. The game could take the form of a choose-your-own-adventure style game, where players have to make decisions that determine the outcome of the story. The game could be set in different time periods and locations, from ancient Greece to a dystopian future, and could feature characters from classic literature as well as original ones.
